page.title: 07Burghley House.
page.content: Burghley House,one of the greatest first Elizabethan houses, built between 1546 and 1587 on the site of a 12th Century monastery, contains 240 rooms.The Kitchen, Great Hall and 18 state rooms,filled with a remarkable collection of works of art,are open to 60,000 visitors each year.It has been the home of Lady Victoria Leatham dau- ghter of 6th Marquis of Exeter(who was awarded the Olympic Order Gold Medal), and her family since 1982. As the present Marquis lives in Canada, Lady Victoria was appointed as Residential Curator. She also works for Sotheby's locally and in London.This year 30 works of art, including the enormous Queen Anne silver wine cistern,are to be loaned to the Washington Exhibition "Treasure Houses of Britain". Orchest- ral Concerts, antique study days and exhibitions are now held at Burghley.
